news_articles.title: Carnegie Hall stands by its chairman , despite tax violations
news_articles.description:
NEW YORK (NYT NEWS SERVICE) .- When Robert F. Smith, the billionaire philanthropist, became the new chairman of Carnegie Hall in 2016, he seemed almost too good to be true. He promised to be a stabilizing presence at Carnegie after the brief, tumultuous reign of his predecessor. Smith was a benefactor with deep pockets and a strong interest in the halls education efforts. Smiths admission that he had failed to report a substantial amount of income to the Internal Revenue Service made Carnegie Hall the latest in a line of major cultural institutions that have found themselves facing questions about the actions of the benefactors that they rely on for their very survival. He has done an outstanding job leading Carnegie Hall. A poster near its locked front doors this fall riffed on the ancient joke  How do you get to Carnegie Hall? And  now Im absolutely committed to continuing my important work, my philanthropy.



Carnegie Halls board members seem to have accepted Smiths mea culpa and moved on. He is beloved, said Darren Walker the president of the Ford Foundation, who is a Carnegie trustee. I do not think we should ask for his resignation. L. Dennis Kozlowski, the former chief executive of Tyco International, sought a prominent profile in New Yorks art world, joining the board of the Whitney Museum of American Art, before being convicted of grand larceny, conspiracy and fraud. And last year Warren B. Kanders was forced to step down as a vice chairman of the Whitney after protests over his companys sale of tear gas. ( He later got out of the tear gas business.) As part of his agreement with prosecutors, Smith will pay $139 million in taxes and penalties, abandon a $182 million tax refund he had been seeking for charitable contributions, and cooperate with ongoing investigations. His departure put an end to talks about a new major Perelman gift; soon after he left, he donated $75 million to build a performing arts center at the World Trade Center site. After Smith arrived, things seemed to calm down on Carnegies board. Everybody makes mistakes in life; what matters is how you deal with them, he said. And hes a man of great integrity, thats everything that I see.



The reluctance of Carnegie Halls board to dethrone Smith is understandable; he is financially generous, gets high marks as a collegial steward, and  named the richest Black man in America by Forbes in 2015  is the first African American to hold the Carnegie Hall post at a time when the lack of diversity at many cultural organizations has become a pressing issue. That money includes $20 million of his personal funds, with the other half coming from Smiths Fund II Foundation, which helped finance the expansion of Carnegie Halls national music education programs. Smith, who loves music (he named his youngest sons, Hendrix and Legend, after Jimi Hendrix and John Legend), has also supported the Halls National Youth Orchestra of the USA; Ensemble Connect, a fellowship program for young professional musicians; and its growing digital activities. The decision made 20 years ago has regrettably led to this turmoil, which has put undue stress and burden on too many.Experts in philanthropy said that they believe the donations he made to Carnegie were not likely at risk of having to be returned.He reached a plea agreement and paid penalties, so I dont think there is any exposure, said Daniel Kurtz, an attorney specializing in nonprofits.
news_articles.summary: Robert F. Smith, the billionaire philanthropist and chairman of Carnegie Hall, has admitted to failing to report a substantial amount of income to the IRS, leading to a plea agreement and payment of penalties. Despite this, the board of Carnegie Hall has chosen not to ask for his resignation, with some members praising his leadership and financial generosity. Smith has made significant donations to the hall, including $20 million of his personal funds, and has supported various programs and initiatives. The incident has highlighted the importance of transparency and accountability in philanthropy, particularly at cultural institutions that rely on the generosity of benefactors.

news_articles.title: Pittsburgh Pirates agree to terms with veteran pitcher Martín Pérez : AP source
news_articles.description: The Pittsburgh Pirates added another veteran left-hander to fill out their starting rotation, agreeing Monday with Martín Pérez on an $8 million, one-year deal. Pérez becomes the second left-handed starter to join Pittsburgh in recent weeks. His salary is less than half the $19.65 million he earned this year after accepting the Rangers' qualifying offer. Other possible players that could fit into the rotation in 2024 are Quinn Priester, Roansy Contreras, Bailey Falter, Andre Jackson and Luis Ortiz, with 2023 top overall pick Paul Skenes likely getting a chance to see how ready he is during spring training.
news_articles.summary: The Pittsburgh Pirates have agreed to terms with veteran pitcher Martín Pérez on an $8 million, one-year deal, adding another left-handed starter to their rotation. news_articles.title: Opening for Postdoctoral Fellow Position on Computational Cancer Genomics job with The University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center
news_articles.description:
A full-time postdoctoral fellow position is available in Professor Wenyi Wang’s lab, at the Department of Bioinformatics and Computational Biology at the University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center. Dr. Wang’s laboratory performs research aiming to gain new knowledge in the evolution of the human genome as well as the cancer genome. The methodological research may include but not limited to statistical models for integrative deconvolution and machine learning methods for prognosis and therapeutic biomarker development. Application

To apply, please email (1) a cover letter describing current and future research, (2) a curriculum vitae, and (3) a list of three references to Dr. Wenyi Wang (wwang7@mdanderson.org).
news_articles.summary: A postdoctoral fellow position is available in Professor Wenyi Wang's lab at the University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center to conduct research on computational cancer genomics, including statistical models for integrative deconvolution and machine learning methods for prognosis and therapeutic biomarker development. The laboratory aims to gain new knowledge in the evolution of the human genome and the cancer genome through methodological research.

news_articles.title: Findings on Insurance Discussed by Investigators at University of Texas Dallas ( Neglected Risks In the Communication of Residential Mortgage - backed Securities Offerings ): Insurance
news_articles.description: 2025 OCT 23 (NewsRx) -- By a News Reporter-Staff News Editor at NewsRx Policy and Law Daily -- Data detailed on Insurance have been presented. According to news originating from Richardson, Texas , by NewsRx correspondents, research stated, “Examining the contractual disclosures during the sale of private-label residential mortgage-backed securities before the 2008 financial crisis, we find that textual contents in the risk-factor section predict subsequent losses and yet were not reflected in pricing.” Additional authors for this research include Feng Zhao and Xiaofei Zhao .
news_articles.summary: Investigators at the University of Texas Dallas have found that contractual disclosures in the sale of private-label residential mortgage-backed securities before the 2008 financial crisis did not accurately reflect subsequent losses, despite containing textual contents that predicted those losses. This discovery highlights the need for improved disclosure practices in the insurance industry to better protect investors.

news_articles.title: Fact Check : University of Texas Revokes Scholarships of Players Who Kneel During Anthem ?
news_articles.description:
Claim:

An article accurately states that five football players at the University of Texas lost their scholarships because they kneeled during the national anthem. Rating:

Rating: Labeled Satire

On Oct. 12, 2023, SpaceXMania.com published an article positing that five University of Texas at Austin football players who kneeled during the national anthem had their scholarships revoked because of their act of protest. These articles are meant to be humorous and are often entirely made up. For background, here is why we sometimes write about satire/humor.
news_articles.summary: Five University of Texas football players had their scholarships revoked after kneeling during the national anthem, according to an article published by SpaceXMania.com. However, the article has been labeled as satire, indicating that the claim is false and meant to be humorous.

news_articles.title: NY Court of Appeals to hear House map case : What to know
news_articles.description: A Democratic push to toss New York’s House map in time for the 2024 election met an apparently divided audience in oral arguments at the state’s top court on Wednesday, with a key judge sounding open to the idea of dispensing with the map. Three members of the state’s seven-member top court, the Court of Appeals, seemed hostile to the idea of revisiting the thorny mapmaking process, a year after an independent expert in Pennsylvania drew the lines. Last year, the commission imploded, failing to reach consensus in its effort to make a map for the midterms, and eventually giving up. Members of the court who ruled against the Democratic-drawn map last year — in a case called Harkenrider v. Hochul — appeared frustrated that they had to reconsider the issue on Wednesday. And I don’t see a basis to overturn that remedy.” Court watchers have said they can see the Court of Appeals ruling either way. Last year, the Court of Appeals voted 4-to-3 to reject the House map drawn by Democratic lawmakers. But Halligan recused herself, citing a close personal relationship with an attorney or party in the case, according to the court.
news_articles.summary: The New York Court of Appeals heard oral arguments on Wednesday in a case regarding the state's House map, with a key judge expressing openness to dispensing with the current map and a divided audience. The court is considering a Democratic push to toss the map in time for the 2024 election, after an independent expert drew the lines in Pennsylvania last year.

news_articles.title: Interview with Matthew Pantelis , FIVEaa – Master Builders Australia
news_articles.description:
Date: Friday, 10 November 2023

Speakers: Denita Wawn, CEO Master Builders Australia

Topics: Closing Loopholes Bill, independent contracting

E&OE

Matthew Pantelis, FiveAA Adelaide: Yesterday in Adelaide, Master Builders Australia nationally were in Adelaide meeting with tradespeople and others with concerns about the government’s Closing Loopholes in industrial relations legislation which is potentially facing a hard time in the senate anyway because there is a couple of key independent MPs in there – David Pocock and Jacquie Lambie. So it compasses all sorts of changes, casualisation of the workforce, a range of things that has businesses concerned about costs and the fact that they may have to make all these changes at a time when there aren’t enough to find workers to come and join them in their profession. Denita Wawn, CEO Master Builders Australia: Good morning. Matthew: So you met with people here yesterday, what was the outcome? This just will put a hand brake on our capacity to do this. So a lot of shaking heads, a lot of anxiety about the significant changes that will dramatically hit the industry. The government and particularly the unions have been pushing for an awful long time, decades, that they disagree with the notion of casual employment of independent contracting, and that everyone really should be either a full time or part-time permanent employee and that’s what’s good for them. Well, at 1.2 million independent contractors in this country disagree with that notion and they are of the view that they want to stick around. Matthew: Denita Wawn, appreciate your time today.
news_articles.summary: Master Builders Australia met with tradespeople and others in Adelaide to express concerns about the government's Closing Loopholes Bill, which could face difficulties in the Senate due to independent MPs David Pocock and Jacquie Lambie. The bill proposes changes to industrial relations legislation, including the casualization of the workforce and independent contracting, which businesses fear will increase costs and make it difficult to find workers in the industry.

So it compasses all sorts of changes, casualisation of the workforce, a range of things that has businesses concerned about costs and the fact that they may have to make all these changes at a time when there aren’t enough to find workers to come and join them in their profession. Denita Wawn, CEO Master Builders Australia: Good morning. Matthew: So you met with people here yesterday, what was the outcome? This just will put a hand brake on our capacity to do this. So a lot of shaking heads, a lot of anxiety about the significant changes that will dramatically hit the industry. The government and particularly the unions have been pushing for an awful long time, decades, that they disagree with the notion of casual employment of independent contracting, and that everyone really should be either a full time or part-time permanent employee and that’s what’s good for them. Well, at 1.2 million independent contractors in this country disagree with that notion and they are of the view that they want to stick around. Matthew: Denita Wawn, appreciate your time today.
news_articles.summary: Master Builders Australia met with tradespeople and others in Adelaide to express concerns about the government's Closing Loopholes Bill, which could face difficulty in the Senate due to independent MPs David Pocock and Jacquie Lambie. New Jersey has already adopted an emissions standard for trucks that also originated in California. “Automotive retailers, which have already invested billions in electric vehicles … warned that a heavy-handed mandate will not work for the dealers — especially with unsold EVs piling up on lots all around the country,” Ray Cantor, NJBIA deputy chief government affairs officer, said in a statement. “
news_articles.summary: New Jersey will phase out the sale of new gas-powered cars by 2035, joining California and New York in the effort to reduce emissions. The move comes after the state adopted an emissions standard for trucks that originated in California, and automotive retailers have expressed concerns about the impact of a heavy-handed mandate on dealerships.

news_articles.title: New Jersey Campaign Finance Laws Helped Democrats
news_articles.description: A new campaign finance law helped Democrats to outraise and outspend Republicans in New Jersey’s November legislative elections, according to NorthJersey. Every Democrat but one voted for the bill in the New Jersey Senate, NorthJersey reported. Democratic state Sen. Vin Gopal, viewed as one of the most vulnerable Democrats in New Jersey, also benefited from the new contribution limits. Democratic state Sen. Nia Gill, the only Democrat to oppose the Elections Transparency Act, said that “we must have reform based on the foundation of public transparency, reform that secures our elections from improper influence and expands access,” in reference to the legislation.
news_articles.summary: Democrats in New Jersey outraised and outspent Republicans in the November legislative elections, thanks to a new campaign finance law that helped them secure more contributions. The Elections Transparency Act, which was supported by every Democrat in the state Senate, allowed for increased contribution limits and greater transparency in campaign finance.

news_articles.title: Fugitive dubbed  pilot to the star likely hiding in northern Quebec : police
news_articles.description: MONTREAL -- Police say a man convicted of an aerial attack on Hydro-Quebec power lines and who has evaded authorities for a week could be hiding out in the province's north. Dube, who is described in local media as the "pilot to the stars" because of his earlier job transporting Quebec celebrities in his plane, allegedly failed to report to a detention centre last week after Quebec's highest court revoked his bail.
news_articles.summary: A convicted felon who was previously known as the "pilot to the stars" for transporting Quebec celebrities is now on the run after failing to report to a detention center last week, with authorities believing he may be hiding in northern Quebec. The man, identified as Dube, was convicted of an aerial attack on Hydro-Quebec power lines and has been evading authorities for a week.

This move is part of the province's efforts to combat climate change and transition to a more environmentally friendly transportation sector.

news_articles.title: Quebec wants travellers returning from holiday travel to test negative for COVID - 19 before boarding planes
news_articles.description: Travellers planning to return home to Quebec after holidaying abroad should face strict measures, including being tested for COVID-19 before hopping on a flight home and once again upon their arrival, the provincial health minister announced today. This comes after Quebec recorded 2,381 new cases on Tuesday, along with 64 new deaths. Saying the situation in Quebec hospitals is "critical," particularly in the Montreal area, Christian Dubé announced he is asking the federal government for a series of measures to prevent travellers from spreading COVID-19 after returning to Quebec. We have to remember what's happening here." Dubé was referring to photos on social media of maskless Quebecers dining out, dancing and drinking in close proximity to other people at resorts.
news_articles.summary: Quebec is implementing strict measures for travellers returning from holiday travel, including mandatory COVID-19 testing before boarding flights and upon arrival, due to the province's critical hospital situation and recent spike in cases (2,381 new cases and 64 new deaths on Tuesday). The provincial health minister, Christian Dubé, is urging the federal government for additional measures to prevent the spread of COVID-19 among returning travellers.

news_articles.title: Dozens fined at Quebec City demonstration against public health rules
news_articles.description: Quebec City police issued more than 30 tickets at a demonstration on Saturday where several hundred people were protesting public health restrictions in place to limit the spread of COVID-19. No arrests were made, but 34 tickets were handed out for violations to public health rules, municipal by-laws and the Highway Safety Code.
news_articles.summary: Dozens of people were fined at a demonstration in Quebec City on Saturday for violating public health rules, municipal by-laws, and the Highway Safety Code. Police issued 34 tickets to protesters, but no arrests were made.

It has prioritized immigrants from French-speaking countries to keep a linguistic majority in the province. Bill 101 has been regulating French language use in the province since 1977. news_articles.title: Parti Quebecois wins tight byelection in Quebec City Jean - Talon riding - Montreal
news_articles.description:
Send this page to someone via email

The Parti Québécois handily won the hotly-contested byelection in the Quebec City riding of Jean-Talon on Monday night, capturing a seat held by the governing Coalition Avenir Québec since 2019. The PQ has never won the riding in the provincial capital region, a former stronghold for the Quebec Liberal party, which held it for 54 years before the Coalition party won a byelection in 2019. PQ Leader Paul St-Pierre Plamondon said Monday night his party’s win was a warning to the government and a demonstration that it could provide a credible alternative capable of beating the powerful Coalition party. The Liberals finished well behind in fourth place.
news_articles.summary: The Parti Québécois won a tight byelection in the Quebec City riding of Jean-Talon on Monday night, capturing a seat held by the governing Coalition Avenir Québec since 2019. The PQ's victory is seen as a warning to the government and a demonstration of its ability to provide a credible alternative to the powerful Coalition party.

news_articles.title: Federal Politicians Chime In on Renewed Quebec Independence Talk
news_articles.description: After a strong showing by separatist Parti québécois (PQ) in a recent by-election, and the party releasing a study saying the province would be financially viable outside the confederation, politicians in Ottawa have chimed in on what this could mean. Federal Transport Minister and the Liberal government’s Quebec lieutenant Pablo Rodriguez warned against re-opening a “divisive” chapter of the country’s history with talks of Quebec independence, while Conservative Party Leader Pierre Poilievre suggested the surge is a reflection of Quebecers being tired of the current party in power in Ottawa. The PQ had never won a riding in the capital before, and now polls in second place behind the ruling Coalition Avenir Quebec. Mr. Poilievre, whose central message is centred around fiscal responsibility and affordability, focused his message on criticism of the Liberal government.
news_articles.summary: Federal politicians in Ottawa have reacted to the recent surge in support for separatist parties in Quebec, with Transport Minister Pablo Rodriguez warning against reopening a "divisive" chapter of Canada's history and Conservative Party Leader Pierre Poilievre suggesting that Quebecers are tired of the current party in power in Ottawa.

news_articles.title: Overcrowding in Quebec ERs putting patient health at risk , doctors say - Montreal
news_articles.description:
Overcrowding in Quebec hospitals is “out of control” and putting the lives of patients at risk, says a group representing chief doctors in the province’s emergency departments. Story continues below advertisement

A spokesman for Quebec’s health minister did not respond to a request for comment. Story continues below advertisement

“You can’t leave these people waiting for too long and that’s what’s happening right now, our emergency stretchers are clogged by patients who are stabilized and are waiting to have the rest of their treatment on the hospital ward,” said Gosselin, who is the head of the emergency department at the regional health authority in Montérégie-Centre, near Montreal. Dr. Judy Morris, head of an association of Quebec ER doctors, said Quebec’s hospital system has become so fragile that even a small rise in the number of patients in the emergency department can have a major impact. “If we can free up those beds right away, we could probably relieve some of the pressure that’s on the emergency rooms,” she said.
news_articles.summary: Overcrowding in Quebec emergency rooms (ERs) is putting patient health at risk, according to a group of chief doctors in the province. The emergency stretchers are clogged with patients who are stabilized and waiting to be admitted to hospital wards, causing a major impact on the hospital system.

news_articles.description:
- Leaders from British Parliament, European Parliament and Indian Parliament participated in the virtual launch ceremony

NEW DELHI, Dec. 1, 2020 /PRNewswire/ -- Europe India Centre for Business & Industry (EICBI), supported by Sivaleen Foundation of Developed India, released its 2020 Class of EuropeIndia40 leaders via a virtually ceremony which saw participation of leaders from British Parliament, European Parliament and Indian Parliament who shared their inputs with the young leaders. # The 14 women and 26 men who made to the EuropeIndia40 list come from all walks of life and represent 19 different nationalities - Austria, Belgium, Czech Republic, Denmark, France, Germany, Hungary, India, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Poland, Portugal, Sweden, Spain, Switzerland and United Kingdom. To know more about EICBI, please do visit - www.eicbi.org
news_articles.summary: At a virtual launch ceremony, Europe India Centre for Business & Industry (EICBI) and Sivaleen Foundation of Developed India revealed their 2020 Class of EuropeIndia40 leaders, comprising 14 women and 26 men from 19 countries. news_articles.title: India must look beyond the China question to understand U mixed signals
news_articles.description: The morning of November 30, 2023, was awkward for India-United States relations. Halfway across the globe in New York, the US District Court issued an indictment accusing an Indian government employee of directing a plot against the assassination of a US citizen and a Khalistani terrorist. While the first development risked a breakdown in the India-US ties, the latter was a welcome affirmation of India’s claims along the disputed boundary with China. Both events aptly summed up the India policy of the Biden administration: a policy of contradictions. What should be made of these mixed signals coming out of the United States? India is just another issue on which Americans are unable to agree. Even the Saudis are in the same boat, leading to their strategic diversification in China and Russia. The United States has historically had credibility issues, from South Vietnam to Afghanistan (and Ukraine in the pipeline). But when it comes to India, this has utterly failed because the corresponding forces run contradictory to each other. The interests of the new professional elites are material and not affected by India’s domestic politics. The writing on the wall cannot be clearer. What can New Delhi do in these circumstances? My observations reflect only one reality: though China remains the biggest strategic challenge for India, the United States is the biggest intellectual challenge for our strategic community. Follow us on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram.
news_articles.summary: On November 30, 2023, a US District Court indicted an Indian government employee for plotting against the assassination of a US citizen and a Khalistani terrorist, while also affirming India's claims along the disputed boundary with China. This highlights the contradictory India policy of the Biden administration, which is unable to agree on India due to credibility issues stemming from historical failures, such as in South Vietnam and Afghanistan.

Sandymount Park Educate Together is an hour away by public transport, but the bus is often full. “We shouldn’t have to move [house] to access non-denominational education... We feel trapped. However, Blackrock was granted the establishment of a new multidenominational school in 2021. “The vast majority of [new] schools are in suburban areas, and this very much has to do with the planning model that has been pursued by the Department of Education,” says Dr JoAnne Mancini, associate professor of history at Maynooth University. The schools that are [in Dublin 8] are serving a brilliant purpose, but they are not serving the needs of that 60 per cent non-Catholic population,” says Fitzpatrick; “It’s not that we want to rip up and tear apart the existing schools. Fitzpatrick says the lack of choice, coupled with limited places, is forcing about 45 per cent of secondary school students to travel out of their locality to attend school. It can mean sitting in traffic for a 1½-hour round trip. 70 per cent: teens in Clonskeagh-Belfield who walk/cycle to school

news_articles.title: Aarhus : The land of architectural splendour and nature
news_articles.description: Modern, international and vibrant, Denmark’s Aarhus is a city that belongs to scholars and students. Though often overshadowed by Denmark’s capital and much populated Copenhagen and other big cities in Scandinavia, it still prides itself in being the epicentre of art and culture — thanks to the many museums and art galleries here — and being a perfect composite of nature (with the many countrysides in its surroundings) and the ocean. Aarhus is contemporary and sophisticated. Sunsets from the harbour on a clear day are particularly majestic. Den Gamble By is an open-air museum in the heart of the city that gives an old town experience with horse riding, boating and music among the many activities offered. Aarhus is easily accessible from other parts of Europe and is just a three hour train ride away from Copenhagen and five hours from Hamburg.
news_articles.summary: Aarhus, Denmark's largest city, is a modern and vibrant destination that combines architectural splendor with natural beauty. Located on the Jutland Peninsula, Aarhus offers a unique blend of art, culture, and nature, with numerous museums, galleries, and outdoor activities, including horse riding, boating, and music at the Den Gamble By open-air museum.

Text description provided by the architects. CEBRA's design of Aarhus Vand headquarters celebrates natural water environments and the careful management of water. news_articles.title: Pemkot Denpasar - Pemkab Klungkung memperkuat pengendalian inflasi
news_articles.description:
Pemkot Denpasar-Pemkab Klungkung memperkuat pengendalian inflasi

Pelaporan terkait dengan investasi ilegal ini paling diterima pada awal semester II Tahun 2023,"

Denpasar (ANTARA) - Pemerintah Kota (Pemkot) Denpasar dan Pemerintah Kabupaten (Pemkot) Klungkung, Bali menandatangani kesepakatan bersama untuk memperkuat kerja sama pembangunan antardaerah yang fokus pada upaya pengendalian inflasi. Sebagai Ibu Kota Provinsi Bali, Jaya Negara berharap Kota Denpasar dapat menjadi hub untuk aktivitas yang meningkatkan nilai tambah dan produk di daerah-daerah kabupaten lainnya di Bali. "Kerja sama ini diharapkan dapat mengurangi ketergantungan terhadap impor produk pertanian, meningkatkan daya saing produk lokal, serta mendukung pariwisata, kebudayaan, perdagangan, dan industri di kedua daerah," katanya.
news_articles.summary: Pemkot Denpasar and Pemkab Klungkung have signed an agreement to strengthen their cooperation in controlling inflation, with a focus on increasing the value added and local products in the province of Bali. The collaboration aims to reduce dependence on imported agricultural products, increase the competitiveness of local products, support tourism, culture, trade, and industry in both cities, and enhance the overall economic development of the province.

news_articles.title: The Jerky Boy Johnny Brennan on Crank Calls , Howard Stern , Seth MacFarlane , and His New Record | Under the Radar
news_articles.description:
The Jerky Boys’ Johnny Brennan on Crank Calls, Howard Stern, Seth MacFarlane, and His New Record Self-Deprecating

Web Exclusive



If you throw on any one of the early tapes from The Jerky Boys, odds are you’re going to have several immediate reactions. If you listen closely, Brennan is often being self-deprecating. We caught up with Brennan to talk about creating the idea, the many characters that appear in his skits, and what it was like making his first Jerky Boys album in two-plus decades, The Jerky Boys: Balloon Animals, which came out in November. Johnny Brennan: I don’t remember my first, per se. But it was more physical stuff [at first]. And I know you’ve voiced Mort in Family Guy. Jack is so colorful and I get to be lots of things all wrapped up in one, you know? Howard was actually very instrumental in catapulting the whole Jerky Boys. It was at a family reunion up in Wurtsboro, New York. And it was about 1985 and my cousins are all coming up to me and they’re like, “Johnny, man, that stuff that you’re doing for Joey and Anthony and Jason.” Do you ever feel remorse for making someone feel flustered or giving them the wrong impression of reality? I’m not mean-spirited, I’m not a mean-spirited person. More or less, I’d say he’s there to shock them. What does that success and that response from your fans mean to you? And it’s [my character talking] Sol Rosenberg and people just enjoy listening to this poor little fucker, you know, his eyes are going crazy. Radio DJs all over the country biting off The Jerky Boys. Howard Stern said it best, he said, “There never will be another Jerky Boys. Funny enough, Jimmy Kimmel actually called me at my house many years ago and asked me to be part of Crank Yankers. So, The Jerky Boys, it stands on it’s own. I was literally pissing myself in the car. We got to follow up number one, we need another record!” So, I remember just sitting down and I needed to get probably about fifteen or twenty calls. Over all these years, I didn’t have a single track that I could use. It’s funny, the title’s not on the record because I didn’t want to ruin Sean Taggart’s artwork. They’d play the shit out of my records and it would inspire and they’d come up with anecdotes and a lot of good stuff. You know, New York City will always bounce back. What is your relationship with The Jerky Boys co-founder, Kamal Ahmed? What have you learned about yourself from being on the phone so often? But now when I do these live shows, I see what it means to people and it means the world to them.
news_articles.summary: Johnny Brennan, co-founder of The Jerky Boys, discusses the origins of the group, his creative process, and the impact of Howard Stern and Seth MacFarlane on his career, as well as his new album, The Jerky Boys: Balloon Animals, which was released in November.

news_articles.title: How Seth MacFarlane A Million Ways to Die in the West is a Stealth Back to the Future Spinoff
news_articles.description: Back to the Future Part III celebrates its 30th anniversary this week, but I don't want to talk about the western-inspired conclusion to Robert Zemeckis and Bob Gale's iconic sci-fi trilogy (all three films are now available to watch on Peacock). Confused, but seemingly satisfied, Albert accepts the story and leaves. It's pure fanboy indulgence on the director's part, but damn, is it absolutely perfect; a wish-fulfillment kind of moment you never knew you wanted to see until you see it — like John Hurt reprising the Alien role of Kane in Mel Brooks' Spaceballs. Enough of the accurate details (like Doc's cumbersome ice maker and flowing mane of white hair) are there to spark delight in the audience. Doc Brown's here,'" the writer-director says in a behind-the-scenes featurette about the small tribute to Part III. " He was just an affable, kind, pleasant guy, who really loved being there. The other thing that was nice to hear was, we were told that he loves that character, and that's refreshing to me because oftentimes you see actors who are identified with iconic characters and all they wanna do is distance themselves [from them]. After delivering two hit TV shows (Family Guy, American Dad) and the highest-grossing original R-rated comedy in history (Ted), MacFarlane had some serious clout and influence in Hollywood that allowed him to give in to his wildest impulses on A Million Ways to Die in the West. Sure, I'm also a little sad and bitter that the epic cameo was ruined for me in one of the promotional trailers.
news_articles.summary: Seth MacFarlane's A Million Ways to Die in the West is a stealth Back to the Future spinoff, with a small tribute to the iconic sci-fi trilogy in a behind-the-scenes featurette. The film is a wish-fulfillment moment for fans, with accurate details and a heartwarming cameo from Michael J. Fox as Doc Brown.

news_articles.title: Seth MacFarlane Fuzzy Door Tech Launches ViewScreen VFX Tools
news_articles.description:
Seth MacFarlane‘s Fuzzy Door production company developed software — running on standard iPhones, Macs and PCs — to let filmmakers see VFX elements on-screen while they were shooting “The Orville: New Horizons” and “Ted,” a prequel series to the two movies featuring MacFarlane’s obnoxious teddy bear. It’s a true advantage for every facet of filmmaking because it accelerates everything we do. For the upcoming “Ted” event series, premiering Jan. 11 on Peacock, MacFarlane used ViewScreen Studio to direct and animate Ted’s face and body movements while the extended production team could see the resulting shots on-set in real time. ViewScreen runs on off-the-shelf iOS, MacOS and Windows consumer hardware. ViewScreen can be used at any point in the production cycle, she said, and eliminates the need for expensive equipment like motion-capture systems. Viewscreen Studio can be used during filming to visualize virtual props, characters and environments, on set or on location in real time. ViewScreen Studio is compatible with the latest release of MacOS (Sonoma) and Windows 11 and can be

used with any cinema camera. ViewScreen Scout runs on iOS devices including any iPhone Pro or iPhone Pro Max and any iPad Pro M1 and higher.
news_articles.summary: Seth MacFarlane's Fuzzy Door production company has developed software called ViewScreen VFX tools that allows filmmakers to see virtual effects elements on-screen while shooting, using standard iPhones, Macs, and PCs. The software has been used to accelerate production for MacFarlane's upcoming "Ted" event series, and eliminates the need for expensive motion-capture systems.

news_articles.title: Heather Rogers , leading media and defamation lawyer who acted for Deborah Lipstadt against David Irving – obituary
news_articles.description:
Heather Rogers, KC: Deborah Lipstadt praised her 'uncanny ability to put her hands on the precise document at precisely the right time' - Alamy

Heather Rogers, KC, who has died from a pulmonary embolism aged 64, was one of the most talented media and defamation lawyers of her generation and appeared in a string of high profile cases, most memorably as junior defence counsel to Richard Rampton (her longtime friend and mentor) in the Lipstadt/Irving libel trial in 2000. There would be several more moves between leading media sets in the years to come. Heather Rogers as a junior, when she was 'the skilful pen behind many a libel silk’s sword', according to George Carman's son and biographer Dominic - Matrix Chambers

A specialist in libel defence work, Rogers cut her teeth as a young barrister working as an in-house lawyer on Robert Maxwell’s London Daily News. After taking Silk in 2006, Rogers defended the Sunday Times over allegations that the cyclist Lance Armstrong had cheated by taking performance enhancing drugs, an unusual case in which damages were paid to the plaintiff but later returned after he confessed his guilt. Ferociously clever but also notably warm, kind, generous and unpretentious, she enjoyed the arts, literature, theatre and music, but, always loyal to her working class roots, preferred Greggs to Pret a Manger and was as happy listening to cheesy pop as she was to anything classical. Heather Rogers, born June 3 1959, died October 18 2023

Some people like to say what begins with the Jews then ends with the Jews. “When you see an act of discrimination and prejudice, call it out for what it is. news_articles.description: Chief Rabbi Ephraim Mirvis has met the United States Special Envoy to Combat and Monitor Antisemitism, Professor Deborah Lipstadt. In talks at his home in London on Friday, they shared concerns over the rise in hate crime in general and in antisemitism in particular. They discussed in detail the incidence of antisemitism on campus as well as opportunities for Muslim-Jewish dialogue. Ambassador Lipstadt was appointed to the post in March this year. During her UK visit, she also met the Deputy Leader of the Labour Party, Angela Rayner, tweeting that it was a pleasure sitting down with members of the party �to reaffirm our shared values and commitment to combat antisemitism and other hatreds, wherever they rear their ugly head.� She was also hosted at the House of Lords by the UK�s special envoy on post-Holocaust issues, Lord Pickles. She was �grateful for the partnership between the US and the UK to fight antisemitism, intolerance and hate on both sides of the Atlantic,� she tweeted. Lipstadt also met with members of the Labour Party and was hosted at the House of Lords by the UK's special envoy on post-Holocaust issues.

news_articles.title: Federal appeals court reinstates suit over Liberace piano – Minnesota Lawyer
news_articles.description:
Listen to this article Listen to this article

BOSTON — The 1st U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals has reinstated a bailment complaint brought by the alleged owner of a piano that the late entertainer Liberace had used during performances, ruling that the six-year statute of limitations for certain contract claims applied to the dispute. The foundation claimed in a lawsuit that the piano was simply on loan and that the Piano Mill breached a warehousing agreement and bailment by refusing to return it upon request. “[W[e conclude that a reasonable juror could find based on the record that the breach-of-bailment claim here, like the breach-of-bailment claim in Aimtek, stems from a consensual arrangement between the parties that mutually benefitted them and not from a merely gratuitous bailment, as Norris and Piano Mill contended is the case for the first time at oral argument,” Judge David J. Barron wrote for the panel. What’s disappointing is that there is now yet one more thing for parties to fight over and for judges to have to decide. Still, he said if there is any lasting takeaway, it is that a bailment is more likely than before to be viewed as arising in contract. Boston attorney Michael J. Rossi said a lesson from the case is that imprecision in documenting the terms of a deal is a surefire way to end up in court. When he refused, the foundation sued him and his business in U.S. District Court, alleging breach of a warehousing agreement and bailment. Moreover, a factfinder could also reasonably determine … that Gibson Brands as bailor and Norris and Piano Mill as bailees each benefitted from this consensual arrangement, as … Gibson Brands [allegedly] obtained storage for a valuable asset and avoided the costs of moving the piano while Norris and Piano Mill obtained substantial publicity and marketing opportunities from having possession of the piano.” Accordingly, the panel concluded, the defendants were not entitled to summary judgment on statute-of-limitations grounds.
news_articles.summary: The 1st U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals has reinstated a lawsuit over a piano used by the late entertainer Liberace, with the court ruling that a six-year statute of limitations applies to certain contract claims. The plaintiff, Gibson Brands, alleges that the piano was loaned to Liberace and that the defendants, Norris and Piano Mill, breached a warehousing agreement and bailment by refusing to return the piano upon request.

news_articles.title: Manzi’s, London W1: ‘Liberace levels of camp and self-aware daftness’ – restaurant review
news_articles.description: Whatever happens to dining out come the future, discerning restaurateurs will always open places such as the new Manzi’s in Soho, and at considerable expense, because old-school glamour will never stop being attractive. If all those requirements seem somewhat outdated, it’s because they probably are. And yet, when the Wolseley Group opens a vast, marble-clad, all-day seafood brasserie serving oysters and dover sole, as well as fish finger sandwiches and knickerbocker glories, many diners will make a note, because here is a venue for all reasons. Manzi’s has about it a whiff of the cruise-ship dining room, which might sound like a slight, but isn’t. At Manzi’s, though, you’re in fact sailing just behind Dean Street and Frith Street, so, the moment you jump ship, its elegant, twinkly spell is broken, because you suddenly find yourself slap-bang in the middle of Soho’s usual bunfight. And a half-pint of prawns for only £14 – was I back in 2015? They go because these places are always open, easy to understand, bookable and tend to have a cast of what seems like thousands on the floor, all cheerily whisking you through a perfectly decent dining experience.
news_articles.summary: Summary: Manzi's, a new restaurant in London's Soho, offers old-school glamour with a whiff of cruise-ship dining rooms. Despite being outdated, the venue's elegant and twinkly spell is broken when diners find themselves in the midst of Soho's bustling streets.

news_articles.title: Lea Michele suggests donating over giving gifts this holiday
news_articles.description:
Lea Michele shared a sweet holiday photo of herself and her family Thursday, with a message that hits home at this time of year: Spend more on charity, and less on gifts. At least, that's what she's doing in her clan, as she noted with an Instagram photo:

Along with the picture of Michele, 34, her husband Zandy Reich and their 4-month-old son Ever Leo, she wrote, "For the holidays this year we decided to forgo presents and instead chose to give back to a few organizations that help children: @stjude and @baby2baby"

She added, "Becoming a mother was the greatest blessing in the world yet this was an incredibly challenging year for so many people and every baby should be safe and cared for. Our love and prayers are with everyone this holiday season."
news_articles.summary: Lea Michele and her family are forgoing gifts this holiday season and instead donating to organizations that help children, such as St. Jude and Baby2Baby. Michele shared a photo of herself, her husband, and their 4-month-old son and wrote about the importance of giving back during a challenging year for many people.

news_articles.title: Review : LEA MICHELE Makes a Landmark Debut at Carnegie Hall
news_articles.description: Every decade or so, there is a zeitgeist event at Carnegie Hall, the kind of sensation that audiences talk about for years and bear witness to as a personal bragging rite. Marian Anderson broke barriers there in 1928. Billie Holliday brought the blues to Carnegie Hall in 1948. In 1961 Judy Garland gave what many have called the concert of the century at Carnegie Hall that was preserved on a best-selling double LP. In 1992 there was an all-star tribute to composer Stephen Sondheim. The seeming ease of her performance belies the amazing technique that makes it all possible. Ms. Michele is a pyrotechnic artist who makes it all seem simple. They also gave us a warm-hearted “To Make You Feel My Love” which Criss also accompanied on the guitar. The arrangements and orchestrations were first-rate and the players were virtuosic without ever distracting from the main event. We can only hope Lea Michele and Steven Jamail will tour the country with this beautiful evening of songs and stories. For tickets and information about other great artists at Carnegie Hall, visit carnegiehall.org.
news_articles.summary: Lea Michele made a landmark debut at Carnegie Hall, showcasing her incredible vocal talent and effortless stage presence with a sensational performance that left audiences in awe. The evening featured a mix of classic songs and personal stories, with first-rate arrangements and orchestrations, and virtuosic playing that complemented Michele's talent without distracting from it.
